Detailed Description

The plVariablesConjunction class implements the conjunction of a set of variables.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef plVariablesConjunction_const_iterator plVariablesConjunction::const_iterator

Associated const_iterator.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

virtual plVariablesConjunction::~plVariablesConjunction ( )
virtual

Destructor, if the variable represents a list erase the list but not the variables on the list.

If empty variable, erase the empty variable

Member Function Documentation

plSymbol plVariablesConjunction::at ( size_t  n) const

Get the n^th symbol of the conjunction.

long double plVariablesConjunction::cardinality ( ) const

Returns the number of values taken by the variable conjunction.

For example, if a variable 'x' takes 10 possible values and another variable 'y' takes 3 possible values, then the conjunction x^y takes 30 (10 x 3) possible values. It returns zero if the variable is not discretized (ie, non-discretized plRealType)

Referenced by plProbTable::plProbTable().

plVariablesConjunction plVariablesConjunction::concatenate ( const plVariablesConjunction &  variable) const
inline

Return the concatenation of the variable var (at right side of the operator) with the variable at left side.

If a variable is found twice, only the first occurrence will be kept and a warning 62 will be raised.

bool plVariablesConjunction::contains ( const plVariablesConjunction &  other) const

Tests if this conjunction is a superset of 'other'.

(a ^ b).contains(a) == true (a ^ b).contains(b) == true (a ^ b).contains(c) == false (a ^ b ^ c).contains(a ^ b) == true (a ^ b ^ c).contains(a ^ b ^ d) == false

int plVariablesConjunction::get_symbol_position ( const plSymbol &  s) const

Return the position of a given symbol in the conjunction.

Return -1 if the symbol is not found.

plSymbol plVariablesConjunction::get_symbol_with_name ( const std::string &  name) const

Returns the first symbol having name as print name.

Raises an exception if no symbol with this print name is found.

plType plVariablesConjunction::get_type ( ) const

Returns the variable's type as a 'plType' object.

In the case of a conjunction, the type of the first variable is returned. The returned object can in turn be converted into the appropriate derived class (plIntegerType, plRealType, plContinuousIntervalType, ...) so you can use its specialized methods and query its characteristics. In order to know into which class the object has to be converted, use the get_var_type() method.

Referenced by plODBCDataDescriptor::set_variables(), and plMysqlDataDescriptor::set_variables().

plVariableType plVariablesConjunction::get_var_type ( ) const

Returns the variable's type as a 'plVariableType' value, where plVariableType is defined as an enum: enum {PL_INTEGER, PL_REAL, PL_CONINUOUS_INTERVAL, PL_DISCRETE_INTERVAL, PL_LABEL, PL_UNKNOWN_TYPE}.

In the case of a multi-dimensional conjunction, the type of the first variable is returned.

Referenced by plODBCDataDescriptor::set_variables(), and plMysqlDataDescriptor::set_variables().

const kplVariableList& plVariablesConjunction::get_variable_list ( ) const
inline

Needed by the Python bindings, but not part of the user API.

Please do not use.

Referenced by plExternalFunction::plExternalFunction(), and plExternalProbFunction::plExternalProbFunction().

bool plVariablesConjunction::has_same_symbols_as ( const plVariablesConjunction &  other) const

Tests if this conjunction has the same symbols as 'other'.

(a ^ b).has_same_symbols_as(b ^ a) == true; (a ^ b).has_same_symbols_as(b ^ a ^ c) == false; (a ^ b).has_same_symbols_as(b) == false;

bool plVariablesConjunction::is_continuous ( ) const

Returns true if the conjunction contains only continuous symbols (ie, plRealType or plContinuousIntervalType), false otherwise.

bool plVariablesConjunction::is_discrete ( ) const

Returns true if the conjunction contains only discrete symbols, false otherwise.

bool plVariablesConjunction::is_discretized ( ) const

Returns true if the conjunction contains only discretizable symbols (ie, all types excluding non-discretized plRealType), false otherwise.

bool plVariablesConjunction::is_empty ( ) const
inline

Returns true if the conjunction is empty.

virtual std::string plVariablesConjunction::name ( ) const
virtual

Gets the variable name, given by the user.

In the case of a conjunction, the type of the first variable is returned.

Reimplemented in plArray.

plVariablesConjunction plVariablesConjunction::operator^ ( const plVariablesConjunction &  variable) const

Return the concatenation of the variable var (at right side of the operator) with the variable at left side.

If a variable is found twice, only the first occurrence will be kept and a warning 62 will be raised.

plVariablesConjunction& plVariablesConjunction::operator^= ( const plVariablesConjunction &  var)

In place concatenation of the variable var (at right side of the operator) with the variable at left side.

If a variable is found twice, only the first occurrence will be kept and a warning 62 will be raised.

WARNING: This operator has effect only on base plVariablesConjunction objects. For all subclasses this operator does not have any effect (e.g. You can't use a plSymbol at the left side of the operator).

plVariablesConjunction& plVariablesConjunction::push_back ( const plVariablesConjunction &  var)
inline

In place concatenation of the variable var (at right side of the operator) with the variable at left side.

If a variable is found twice, only the first occurrence will be kept and a warning 62 will be raised.

WARNING: This operator has effect only on base plVariablesConjunction objects. For all subclasses this operator does not have any effect (e.g. You can't use a plSymbol at the left side of the operator).

Member Data Documentation

kplVariableSet plVariablesConjunction::variable_set_
mutableprotected

Mirrors variable_list_.

variable_set_ may be empty, use variable_set() to make sure it is valid and get it. Used to speed up operator^=().

kplModVariableVector plVariablesConjunction::variable_vector_
mutableprotected

Mirrors variable_list_.

variable_vector_ may be empty, use variable_vector() to make sure it is valid and get it. Used to speed up operator[](size_t).
